meanings.sent1: She will swoon if she sees blood.
meanings.sent2: The princess swooned at the sight of the handsome prince.
meanings.sent3: The idea of spiders makes her swoon.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat made him swoon like a wilting flower.
meanings.sent5: The overwhelming fear caused her to swoon and collapse.

meanings.definition: A sudden feeling of faintness or dizziness.
meanings.sent1: The heatwave caused a swoon in many people.
meanings.sent2: She felt a swoon coming on as she stood up too quickly.
meanings.sent3: The roller coaster ride left her in a swoon of excitement.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of fresh bread put her in a swoon of hunger.
meanings.sent5: The breathtaking view from the mountaintop left him in a swoon of awe.

meanings.definition: To be overwhelmed by a strong emotion.
meanings.sent1: She would swoon with joy whenever she saw a puppy.
meanings.sent2: He swooned with love for his new baby sister.
meanings.sent3: The romantic movie made her swoon with happiness.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful music made him swoon with emotion.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected surprise made her swoon with delight.
